FDR field significance

fieldSignificance_FDR.Rd

Field significance using the false detection rate approach

Usage

fieldSignificance_FDR(pvals, level = 0.1)

Arguments

pvals

numeric vector, p-values of local tests

level

numeric in (0, 1), level at which field significance is evaluated

Value

pFDR, the FDR p-value, interpreted as follows: local p-values smaller than pFDR are field-significant.

References

Benjamini, Y., and Y. Hochberg (1995), Controlling the false discovery rate: A practical and powerful approach to multiple testing, J. R. Stat. Soc., Ser. B., 57, 289–300.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
set.seed(123456) # Make example reproducible
level = 0.1 # Level of the test
data(nhtemp) # Average Yearly Temperatures in New Haven
# Add 29 stationary series to nhtemp series
X = matrix(c(nhtemp, rnorm(length(nhtemp)*29)),
             nrow=length(nhtemp))
# Compute local p-values from a MK test
pvals = rep(NA, 30)
for (i in 1:30) {
    pvals[i] = generalMannKendall(X[, i], level=level)$P
}
# Evaluate field significance
pFDR = fieldSignificance_FDR(pvals, level)
which(pvals <= level) # Locally-significant sites
which(pvals <= pFDR) # FDR-significant sites
} # }
